trans-unit.source: Open the Android SDK Manager by clicking the icon on the toolbar of Android Studio or by clicking **Tools** -> **Android** -> **SDK Manager** on the menu.
trans-unit.target: Open the Android SDK Manager by clicking the icon on the toolbar of Android Studio or by clicking **Tools** -> **Android** -> **SDK Manager** on the menu.

trans-unit.source: Locate the target version of the Android SDK that is used in your project , open it, and choose **Google APIs**, if it is not already installed.
trans-unit.target: Locate the target version of the Android SDK that is used in your project , open it, and choose **Google APIs**, if it is not already installed.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down to **Extras**, expand it, and choose **Google Play Services**, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down to **Extras**, expand it, and choose **Google Play Services**, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: Note the SDK path, for use in the following step.
trans-unit.target: Note the SDK path, for use in the following step.

trans-unit.source: Open the **build.gradle** file in the app directory.
trans-unit.target: Open the **build.gradle** file in the app directory.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Sync Project with Gradle Files** icon in the tool bar.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Sync Project with Gradle Files** icon in the tool bar.

trans-unit.source: Open **AndroidManifest.xml** and add this tag to the *application* tag.
trans-unit.target: Open **AndroidManifest.xml** and add this tag to the *application* tag.
